plugins.name: Color Combo
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin enables direct testing of color combinations in your design file. This allows the timeless color harmonies of Wada Sanz≈ç to be integrated into modern digital design processes without intermediate steps.


Steps

  1. Open the Color Combo plugin
  2. Select two color styles from the dropdown (or add new ones)
  3. Apply these color styles to your design elements (frames, text, etc.)
  4. Choose a color combination: Click any combination preview, or hit Random for instant variety Toggle Muted colors for subtle palettes
plugins.tagline: Bringing the timeless color harmonies of Wada Sanz≈ç (1883‚Äì1967) to your digital workflow.

plugins.name: Watermark Plugin
plugins.description:
Easily add a customizable text or image watermark to any frame or group in your Figma files.

Choose text or upload a PNG/JPG, set position, size, color, opacity, and more ‚Äì all in a simple and intuitive interface.


Features:


Add watermark as text or image (PNG/JPG)

Set position (X/Y), size, color, and opacity

Simple UI, works with multiple selections

No code or plugins required for recipients ‚Äì just run and watermark!

Perfect for marking drafts, sharing designs, or protecting your intellectual property before sharing.

developed by Dmitry Chekalin

plugins.name: Typographica
plugins.description:
Typographica helps you quickly create beautiful and balanced font combinations for any project ‚Äî from corporate dashboards to creative websites.


The plugin analyzes your chosen primary font, project style, and font metrics to generate harmonious font pairs automatically.


What does Typographica do?


  1. Generates Primary + Secondary + Accent font combinations
  2. Takes into account your project style (7 styles: business, corporate, modern, elegant, fun, personal, minimalist)
  3. Analyzes font metrics (x-height, glyph width, weight, stylistic characteristics)
  4. Automatically filters out fonts that do not fit the selected style
  5. Lets you save combinations as Figma text styles and variables
  6. Optionally adds smart descriptions to generated styles
  7. Supports manual swapping of secondary and accent fonts
  8. Works with any available fonts ‚Äî Google Fonts, local fonts, and Figma-supported fonts


Who is it for?


  1. Product designers ‚Äî to quickly build solid typography systems
  2. UX/UI designers ‚Äî to improve readability and visual rhythm
  3. Brand designers ‚Äî to find well-balanced and creative font pairs
  4. Beginners ‚Äî to get guidance on what fonts work well together
  5. Experienced designers ‚Äî to save time and explore unexpected combinations


How does it work?


  1. Choose your project style
  2. Select a Primary Font
  3. Click Change Pairs
  4. Browse the generated font pairs and accent options
  5. Save styles or variables in one click
  6. Tweak and refine as needed


Why use Typographica?


Save time ‚Äî no more manual font pairing

Get better quality ‚Äî pairs are based on font metrics and style fit, not guesswork

Flexible ‚Äî works for classic and modern designs alike

Customizable ‚Äî easy to adjust pairs or generate new ones on the fly


Styles and Tokens Support


Typographica not only generates font pairs, but also helps you create full-fledged text styles and design tokens in Figma.


You can save your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts as reusable Text Styles and optionally as Variables (Tokens) ‚Äî making your typography consistent across your project and design system.


Style Description Table


Typographica can automatically generate a style description table for your font system ‚Äî right inside Figma.


It creates a clear, editable table summarizing your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts, with suggested usage and style notes.


Perfect for documenting typography choices or sharing with your team and developers.


Typographica is your smart font pairing assistant in Figma. Make your typography cleaner, more beautiful, and more consistent ‚Äî with less effort.

plugins.name: Elemental
plugins.description:
Elemental lets you export images and copy color and shadow values in a single click‚Äîno need to set a layer to export, or break a color style to see the hex value. Elemental is built for those quick one-off moments when a developer needs an asset or another app is asking for your primary brand color.


What it does:

  1. Export one or more layers as images in your desired file type and size
  2. Copy the fill color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  3. Copy the stroke color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  4. Copy a layer's shadows in css format


How it works:

  1. Keep your Elemental panel handy
  2. Select a layer
  3. Click your desired export or copy button

This plugin allows you to bulk replace and export text layers in Figma using CSV files‚Äîperfect for efficient content updates and translation workflows.

Highly useful for localization, bulk edits, or working with external editors.


[Key Features]

‚ë†Bulk Replace Text

Simply upload a CSV file where column A = target text and column B = replacement text. The plugin will find and replace matching text layers in your Figma file.


‚ë°Export Text

Export text content from selected frames or layers into a CSV file. Ideal for translation or review processes.


[How to Use]

Open the plugin and go to the ‚ÄúReplace‚Äù tab to upload your CSV and execute replacement.

Use the ‚ÄúExport‚Äù tab to download the text from selected layers as a CSV file.

When a frame is selected, all text layers within that frame will be exported together as a CSV file.

- Create and share your own custom brand showrooms as an interactive website and pdf, and showcase and maintain your branding best practices.

- Share your official brand copy, brand logos, brand colors, brand fonts, brand rules and custom brand sections.

- Invite your team and clients to your official brand spaces, and enable collaboration on one or more brands at a time.


For any questions or feedback, feel free to ping us at team@yourethos.io

plugins.name: Background Manager
plugins.description:
Background Manager makes it easy to switch your Figma canvas background between light, dark, or any custom color ‚Äî instantly.


Use presets, apply hex values, or pick your own color with a live preview. Includes an optional "close after apply" toggle and resizable window for a smooth, focused workflow.


Built for designers who care about context, mood, and file readability.


  1. Light, Dark, and Custom background modes
  2. Color picker + hex input
  3. Auto-syncs to your current canvas background
  4. "Close after applying" option
  5. Minimal, Figma-native UI

plugins.name: LARA for Figma
plugins.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/
plugins.tagline: Bring the power of LARA to your process

This Figma plugin allows users to convert raster images into scalable vector graphics with a single click. Enhance your design process by transforming pixel-based images into smooth, resolution-independent vectors directly within Figma.

  1. Vectorizes selected image nodes into SVG format.

  1. Select an image node on your Figma canvas.
  2. Click the ‚ÄúVectorize Image‚Äù button in the plugin UI.
  3. The plugin will generate an SVG vector output placed adjacent to the original image node.


Notes

plugins.name: ‰∏ÄÈîÆÁøªËØëÂÖÉÁ¥† Quick Translate
plugins.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.

plugins.tagline: Quick Translate: Instant Translation for Figma Elements

137614.name: ‰∏ÄÈîÆÁøªËØëÂÖÉÁ¥† Quick Translate
137614.description:
Introduction

Quick Translate is a Figma plugin designed to help you instantly translate selected text elements into different languages with just one click. Save time and improve your workflow by translating text directly within your design files.


Function Description

  1. Translate selected text elements into a specified target language.
  2. Supports multiple languages and automatic translation of all text layers in a Figma selection.
  3. Easy-to-use interface to select languages and apply translations quickly.
  4. Ideal for designers working on multilingual projects or collaborating with global teams.


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text elements in your Figma file.
  2. Open the plugin from the "Plugins" menu.
  3. Choose the target language for translation.
  4. Click the "Translate" button, and the selected text will be replaced with the translated version.


Notes

  1. Ensure your Figma selection includes text elements, as the plugin only works with text layers.
  2. The translation may vary depending on the accuracy of the API and the language selected.
  3. For optimal results, select only relevant text elements to avoid unnecessary API calls.

plugins.name: Grid Forge
plugins.description:
Grid Forge is a powerful Figma plugin that revolutionizes table creation by using your existing design system components. With intelligent auto layout, flexible width settings, and advanced data mapping, Grid Forge helps teams create responsive, consistent tables in seconds.


Use your own header and cell components, ensuring brand and Ul consistency. Configure columns with FIXED, HUG (with minimum width), or FILL modes, and instantly preview changes in

real-time.


Import data via CSV or Excel, map multiple fields per component, and watch as Grid Forge intelligently applies your design system to every table row saving time and maintaining design integrity across complex Uls like dashboards and forms.

plugins.name: Pinnaflow Collections
plugins.description:
Figma CMS Table Generator helps you structure CMS data directly in your Figma file, and export it as a Webflow-compatible CSV.


With this plugin, you can:


üóÇ Create CMS Collections

Define fields with types like Plain Text, Rich Text, Image, Number, Date, or Switch ‚Äî all directly in your Figma UI.


üß© Add CMS Items

Populate data using a form-driven interface. Each item becomes a variant within your CMS component.


üì§ Export CSV for Webflow

Download a ready-to-import CSV with your data structured according to Webflow CMS standards.


üéØ Apply CMS Data to Design

Inject field values into selected Figma elements by choosing collection, item, and field ‚Äî no copy-pasting.


‚ö° Real-Time Preview & Auto Validation

Live feedback lets you know when your component is ready for export, and disables the export button if any structure is invalid.


üñº Responsive & Intuitive UI

A clean and responsive layout, with tooltips, modals, and auto-tab interactions for seamless workflow.


üõ† How to use:

Create a Collection

Go to the "Create Collection" tab ‚Üí enter a collection name ‚Üí define fields ‚Üí click "Create Collection".


Add Items

Switch to "Create Item" ‚Üí fill in values for each defined field ‚Üí click "Create Item".


Export to CSV

Select the CMS component ‚Üí click "Export CSV" in the Collection tab.


Apply Data to UI

In "Apply Data" tab ‚Üí choose collection, item, and field ‚Üí select a text layer in your design ‚Üí click "Apply to Selected Element".


‚úÖ Best Practices

Your CMS component must contain a frame named ‚ÄúCMS Properties‚Äù, with text layers in the format:

Field Name | Field Type


When applying data, make sure the selected element is a single text node.


Only one CMS component should be selected at a time when creating items or exporting.


Use consistent field names and valid types for clean CSV output and Webflow compatibility.
plugins.tagline: Create CMS collections in Figma and export them for Webflow import

plugins.name: Component State Mapper
plugins.description:
Tired of getting lost in complex component variants? Struggling to track every possible state, prevent design inconsistencies, and explain component logic to your team?


Introducing State Mapper, the essential Figma plugin that transforms your complex component sets into clear, interactive, and easy-to-understand visual maps. Stop navigating your variants blindfolded and gain a bird's-eye view of your entire component architecture.


With a single click, State Mapper instantly generates a live flowchart of all your variants, showing you exactly how they connect and what properties change between them.


Key Features:


  2. üó∫Ô∏è Instant Visual Mapping: Automatically generate beautiful, easy-to-read diagrams from any component set. See the full picture, from simple buttons to complex data tables.
  3. üî¨ Powerful Filtering & Layouts: Is your map too complex? No problem. Isolate exactly what you need by filtering properties and values. Switch between Hierarchical, Graph, and Matrix layouts to find the perfect view.
  4. ‚ö†Ô∏è Smart "Missing State" Detection: Our most powerful feature! State Mapper intelligently analyzes your component's properties and automatically flags potential "holes" or missing variants in your system, helping you prevent bugs before they happen.
  5. ü§ù Seamless Handoff & Documentation: Export your component maps as SVG or PNG to include them directly in your documentation on Confluence, Notion, or Jira. Make sure developers understand the logic perfectly.
  6. üîÑ Live Sync: Keep your map updated in real-time. As you add, remove, or change variants, your map reflects those changes instantly.

Who is it for?


State Mapper is built for meticulous Product Designers, UI/UX Designers, and Design System teams who want to build more robust, error-free, and well-documented components.


Install State Mapper today and bring order, clarity, and intelligence to your design system!
plugins.tagline: Bring clarity to component chaos.

plugins.name: Figma to Unity Exporter
plugins.description:
### Tired of manually recreating your Figma designs in Unity?


Figma To Unity Importer is the ultimate workflow solution designed to bridge the gap between designers and developers. Stop wasting hours meticulously rebuilding UI and start converting your high-fidelity Figma designs into fully functional, native Unity uGUI components with just a few clicks.


**‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: This is one half of a powerful 2-part system.**

This Figma plugin exports your design data. To bring your designs to life in Unity, you need the professional importer asset from the Unity Asset Store.


---


### **‚û°Ô∏è Step 1: Get the Professional Unity Importer Asset**


To complete the workflow, please purchase and import the required companion asset from the Unity Asset Store. It's the engine that powers the entire import process in Unity, packed with advanced features to ensure a perfect conversion.


**[>> Get "Figma To Unity Importer" on the Unity Asset Store ($15) <<](https://assetstore.unity.com/preview/323342/1075296)**


---


### **‚ú® Key Features:**


* **Accurate Conversion:** Preserves layer hierarchy, names, positions, sizes, and rotations.

* **Advanced Text Support:** Exports text as TextMeshPro components, maintaining font family, **font weight (including variable fonts)**, size, and color.

* **Image Export:** Automatically exports image fills and creates native Unity `Image` components.

* **Resolution Scaling:** Scale your entire UI to different screen sizes automatically.

* **Smart & Simple UI:** Remembers your last used settings and supports multiple languages.


### **üöÄ Workflow:**


**1. In Unity (Setup):**

* Purchase and import the importer from the Asset Store using the link above.

* Install the required packages as described in the asset's documentation (TextMeshPro, UI, Newtonsoft.Json).


**2. In Figma (Export):**

* Run this plugin.

* Select the single, top-level Frame you want to export.

* Configure your options (target resolution, include images, etc.).

* Click "Export" to download the `.zip` file.


**3. In Unity (Import):**

* Unzip the downloaded file.

* Drag the `FigmaExport` folder into your Unity `Assets`.

* Open the importer via `Tools > Figma Importer`.

* Assign the `hierarchy.json` file and click "Create UI".


That's it! Your design is now a native, ready-to-use UI in Unity.
